title: Impulse - motor driving force on incline

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> can move with negligible friction on a ramp that is at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> from the horizontal, as shown in the figure. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the motor creates a varying string tension <math alttext="F sub uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math> given by <math alttext="F sub uppercase T equals 2 k lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> is a positive constant. If the positive direction is taken to be up the ramp, what is the magnitude of the impulse exerted on the block between time <math alttext="t sub 1, end sub, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and a later time <math alttext="lowercase t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="k times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus lowercase t sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="k lowercase t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus m g the sine of theta times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="k times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus lowercase t sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis, minus m g the sine of theta times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2 minus lowercase t sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>−</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="k times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus lowercase t sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis, minus m g times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2 minus lowercase t sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><msup><mpadded><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>−</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="k times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus lowercase t sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis, minus m g the sine of theta times, open parenthesis, lowercase t sub 2 minus lowercase t sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>−</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
